page.title: 18CROSSFIELD FARM
page.content: 1 land rover,1 roller,1 truck, 1 trailor,1 rotavator,dills,1 water pump,1 bailer,1 lot of welding equipment and four storage tanks. Insurance for this equipment is Â£2,000 per year.No special licence was required to drive any of the farming equipment.Their normal working day starts at 7a.m.&ends at 11p.m harvest time,which is from August to October this being their busy time of year.In August is harvesting the crops, September ploughing and October drilling for new crops.The Winter months were spent,feeding the cows, cleaning ditches and streams ,mending farming equipment and cutting hedges. As well as cattle and cereals Crossfield had 300-400 trees,but there was a disease known as duckshell disease which killed off the trees.The disease killed all of their trees.
